intro: Tetramolopium rockii, commonly known as the rock tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble single blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Tetramolopium rockii is adapted to withstand drought and heat, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
